# delegate

**Instance Property**

The view’s delegate.

## Declaration

```swift
@MainActor weak var delegate: (any MTKViewDelegate)? { get set }
```

## Discussion

A delegate is optional. If you provide one, the view calls the delegate when it needs to update its contents. You should either provide a delegate or subclass the view to override the [doc://com.apple.documentation/documentation/UIKit/UIView/draw(_:)] method, but not both.
